page.title: 20The local environment.
page.content: The area surrounding the three villages is a bit of a mixture.To the East the countryside has been ruined by the china clay workings which have left the white mountains of waste which visitors to Cornwall always notice.To the West the land is agricultural in the main, finally ending with the cliffs and the sea beyond.North East,along the main A30 lies the Goss Moors,unspoilt rough moorland very much like Bodmin Moor to the North again.In spite of being under the shadow of the clay tips,the feeling is of a rural,but harsh environment with none of the beauty of a Cotswold village,but with a charm of its own. The climate is mild,and being so near the sea the weather is often wet as the winds carry the clouds towards the land.
